item.title: [GRA5/GRA7/GRA9/SBG5/WAW1/SGP1/BHS5/SYD1][Public cloud] - End of life for Kubernetes 1.18
item.description:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Sep 6, 07:00 UTC  -  Sep 8, 15:00 UTC

Jun 3, 02:35 UTC
Scheduled - Start time : 06/09/2022 07:00 UTC
End time : 08/09/2022 15:00 UTC
Service impact : Every Kubernetes 1.18 will be force upgraded to the next minor version (1.19)
Service improvement: The aim of this maintenance is to upgrade a deprecated cluster to a supported newer version

item.title: [SGP2][Public Cloud] Upgrade to Stein
item.description:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Aug 17, 06:00 - 14:00 UTC

Jun 15, 23:33 UTC
Scheduled - A maintenance operation is scheduled for the SGP2 region on August 17, 2022, between 06:00 and 14:00 (UTC). No disruption is expected on your instances. Some APIs will remain unreachable during the operation.

The API endpoints that will be maintained are the following:
https://compute.sgp2.cloud.ovh.net
https://network.compute.sgp2.cloud.ovh.net
https://volume.compute.sgp2.cloud.ovh.net
https://image.compute.sgp2.cloud.ovh.net
https://workflow.sgp2.cloud.ovh.net
https://orchestration.sgp2.cloud.ovh.net

The other regions will remain accessible by API and via your OVH manager.
This operation allows us to prepare for the future. Thanks to this OpenStack upgrade, we will be able to continue to improve our Public Cloud offering by providing you with new features in the coming months.
The API calls you are used to using will not change, this new version is backwards compatible with the old one.
The target versions of the OpenStack components in this region will be:
Glance : 18 (Stein) ;
Cinder : 14 (Stein) ;
Nova : 19 (Stein) ;
Neutron : 14 (Stein) ;
Heat : 12 (Stein) ;

The components not affected by this operation are :
Keystone : 11 (Ocata) ;
Swift : 2.25 (Ussuri) ;
Horizon : 13 (Queens) ;
Mistral : 7 (Rocky) ;

This update is an important step in the development of the product. Other regions will be concerned by equivalent developments in the coming weeks. To know the detail of the new functionalities, go to https://releases.openstack.org/stein/highlights.html
Compute (Nova) https://docs.openstack.org/nova/stein/reference/api-microversion-history.html#maximum-in-newton
Network (Neutron) https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/neutron/stein.html
Volume (Cinder) https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/latest/contributor/api_microversion_history.html#maximum-in-newton
If you want to test the behavior of the updated software versions you can use the GRA9 and SBG7 regions which already expose the target versions.

item.title: [SBG5][Workflow Management] - Failed backups
item.description:
Jun 22, 10:50 UTC
Monitoring - Start time : 21/06/2022 00:00 UTC
Service impact : Customers automated workflows such as automatic instance backup may have failed during early hours of 21st June and early hours of 22nd June.
Ongoing actions : Our teams have taken action to resolve the situation and future backup triggers will take place as expected. An in-depth analysis is taking place to prevent such issues in the future.
Teams are monitoring to ensure that backups are done correctly.

item.title: PCI - GRA1 - host673267
item.description:
Jun 19, 13:18 UTC
Resolved - Incident full recovery: 13:10 UTC
Root cause of incident: Host hardware (disk) failure
Advice: Customers are recommended to check their instances. If customers have a more up to date backup than what has been restored, we advised using your more up-to-date backups.

Jun 19, 13:13 UTC
Update - Update: Instance eb8c851d-cf05-4ad1-b034-4b4f68aac609 has been recovered with the last internal backup successfully.

Jun 19, 12:33 UTC
Update - Update: Instance 3b35a56e-d4ad-4852-91e2-05faa3e1fc1b has been recovered with the last internal backup successfully.

Jun 19, 11:59 UTC
Update - UPDATE: Instance e95ce284-f051-4304-9093-92af63383f42 has been recovered with the last internal backup successfully.

Jun 19, 11:43 UTC
Update - UPDATE: Instance 750092ec-0c54-4fbb-b005-943317d6c1ca has been recovered with the last internal backup successfully.

Jun 19, 11:17 UTC
Update - UPDATE: Instance 472cf5c1-28ec-43fe-8c26-439713f8a99b has been recovered with the last internal backup successfully.

Jun 19, 10:48 UTC
Update - UPDATE: Instance 7ab48793-12b2-4bd0-86c9-14fabb5e8073 has been recovered with the last internal backup successfully.

Jun 19, 09:54 UTC
Update - UPDATE: Instance ee9f2de4-3dfc-43f1-92ed-98d2bdfb6c60 has been recovered with the last internal backup successfully.

The remaining instances are also attempting to recover from the last internal backup. Unfortunately, we are not able to provide ETA as such recovery takes several hours to complete. Administrators are doing all possible to ensure all services get recovered as soon as possible.

We apologise for the inconvenience and we advise customers if they have more up to date backups, to restore them after our recovery has completed.

Jun 19, 05:31 UTC
Update - INFO: Impacted host: host673267.gra1
Impacted VMs:
ee9f2de4-3dfc-43f1-92ed-98d2bdfb6c60
472cf5c1-28ec-43fe-8c26-439713f8a99b
750092ec-0c54-4fbb-b005-943317d6c1ca
eb8c851d-cf05-4ad1-b034-4b4f68aac609
e95ce284-f051-4304-9093-92af63383f42
7ab48793-12b2-4bd0-86c9-14fabb5e8073
3b35a56e-d4ad-4852-91e2-05faa3e1fc1b

The above instances uses eg-ssd flavors which are advertised as NO Raid local SSD storage virtual machines (only the eg-* machines are ceph triple replication). Due to the failure of the disk on the host, the data is lost. Our administrators are attempting to restore the VMs. At this moment there is no ETA or guarantee for a successful recovery, however our administrators are doing all possible to have a successful recovery.

Jun 19, 04:00 UTC
Identified - Hardware failure. Recovering data from backups
